Posts.Content: Feb 15, 2009 02:25AM Smile2006 wrote: I had my first chemo Feb. 12th.  Was on the steroid high until today  It definately takes a toll on you!  I am a very active girl....and hate being down.  Had my Nuelstra shot yesterday and so far not too bad on the aches, but I do know that I have a high tolerence for pain.  I will also being getting the herceptin every week, chemo every three weeks for a total of 6 sessions then a year of herceptin.  I am following more on the other thread, but will check back in here too. Hope everyone had an enjoyable Valentines Day!
Posts.Title: Starting TCH in Feb 2009? (Taxotere, Carboplatin, Herceptin) Denali Smile2006

Posts.Content: Feb 15, 2009 04:16PM Smile2006 wrote: I didn't get too red....my chest did just a bit, but when I am in the sun...the same thing happens.  From what I have read on the third day is crash day and the 4th and 5th your body is recovering from it.  Yesterday was my third day and it wasn't too bad.  But this morning I woke up aching all over from that shot.  Plus I am getting that cold that everyone in Florida seems to have right now.  All I want to do is get up and start cleaning my house.....never thought I would say those words...I hate cleaning!  But I hate not being able to do anything either.   Bluedasher is right....that thread is great!  It really helped me get prepared, so if you have any questions or concerns...pop over and ask...all the ladies are very sweet and ready to help when they can  !
Posts.Title: Starting TCH in Feb 2009? (Taxotere, Carboplatin, Herceptin) Denali Smile2006

Posts.Content: Feb 23, 2009 03:06AM Smile2006 wrote: Dianne- I dont know what to say..I just started this treatment and right after the first session I ended up with a cold, which has lasted over a week.  Today is the first day that I felt like myself again.  I have 5 more Tx to go and I hope and pray I can make it through them all.  There is another thread that has ladies that have been going through this just about as long as you....re-post and see what their thoughts are. .http://community.breastcancer.org/forum/69/topic/578284
Posts.Title: Starting TCH in Feb 2009? (Taxotere, Carboplatin, Herceptin) Denali Smile2006

Posts.Content: Feb 16, 2009 11:59PM Smile2006 wrote: Sisterwhocares:  My treatment was Thursday as well and I am finally feeling better.  I got my heating pad out and wrapped around my hips (where it hurt the worst), but the heating blanket sounds like a much better idea.  Will have to look into that one : )!  I understand your sister not wanting to deal with it, I have sooo many friends wanting me to talk to others who are going through this and I am just not interested.  I know that they mean well, but this is something I need to work through in my own head first and come out and play when I am ready, so just be patient.  I read that Claritin (NO D) will help with the pain of the aches.  I did not have any on hand, but I will before my next treatment.  Motrin hasn't worked a whole lot, but hot baths have calmed my nerves.  You are a wonderful sister for taking care of her and her kids...all I have is two brothers who have absolutely no clue.  I am divorced, but back with my ex.  He has actually been really good to me.  Good luck, and if your sister feels like it, have her read the thread that is posted earlier.  There are women there that are ending their treatments as well as us newbies.  They are full of advice and support.  She does not have to post....but just knowing what to expect helps out a great deal.  Hope she feels better soon.....Shari
Posts.Title: Starting TCH in Feb 2009? (Taxotere, Carboplatin, Herceptin) Denali Smile2006

Posts.Content: Mar 5, 2009 12:03AM Smile2006 wrote: I am jealous but happy for you ladies that your hair is coming back in.  I will get there soon enough....but yesterday I finally shaved my head.  My scalp was hurting for two days on top of shedding everywhere.  I was at work and everytime I walked down the hallway it would seem like my hair would fall out and find its way in my mouth..  Had enough and shaved it....It definately feels much better.  I could not look at my head until this morning...but I am ok with it now.
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Aug 14, 2009 04:47PM Smile2006 wrote: I am 18 weeks PFC now....still wearing my wig or ball cap....my hair is coming back straight..just the way it was before chemo.  Does it turn curly at a particular time, or would I know by now?? Hey Jamieh..how are you doing..it has been several weeks since I have been on and not enough time to catch up on the reading :(...Hope all is good! Shari

Posts.Content: Apr 24, 2009 09:51PM Smile2006 wrote: I just finished with my last TX....I have some regrowth but it is sparatic.....thinking of buzzing it off to make it all even....any suggestions???
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: May 11, 2009 04:47PM Smile2006 wrote: Hey Ladies!  I just heard something new...and wanted to share it with you.  I have a friend that is an estitician (do not know how to spell that..sorry) , she was told that putting aloe vera (from the plant) directly on your scalp....letting it stay on for awhile, then washing it off...helps hair growth.  I looked it up on the web and this is what I found....I am definately going to give this a try.  I am on Herceptin for a year and from what I have read my re-growth will be very slow.  Here is the website: http://www.ehow.com/how-does_4620422_aloe-vera-promote-hair-growth.html
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Jun 9, 2009 10:29PM Smile2006 wrote: Lisa, let us know how the acupuncture works for hot flashes...I am very interested in that one.  Mine are getting worse.  I use to only have a couple during the day and most of them at night (of course, when I am trying to sleep), but lately they are getting more frequent during the day.....cant wait to hear to see if they work for you..good luck!  I dont have any length on my hair, but it is feeling in pretty good....my guy says that I am looking like GI Jane, lol!  I just want to look like the old me!
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Jun 21, 2009 12:52PM Smile2006 wrote: Ok...I need to vent!  I have come to grips with my wieght...and actually am ok with it, until my ex/bf/whatever....tells me he thinks I look better in a bikini at my lower weight (which is only about 5 pounds)..He has paid for a trainer for me, bought me a gym membership....he goes everyday at least 5 times a week!  I am soooo depressed with having no hair...I dont need his imput!!!  Last night I drank a whole bottle of wine all by myself...and if there was another one here I would be drinking it now!
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Jun 22, 2009 10:30PM Smile2006 wrote: I had a consult in regards to the Latisse today...I have always had short, thin eyelashes...so I am going to give it a try.  My exbf is funding that one (he should after his comment), but I look like GI Jane....very soft stuble all over filling in.  Cant wait for it to grow in length..straight, curly whatever as long as it grows.  BOLD I agree...my wig is starting to itch from my hair growth, but I am not brave enough to go without a wig or a buff.... I am having issues with my radiation!  You can see the area in which it is treating, becoming red and very irrated ( Just in time for my trip to the tropics next week ) I am a bag of tears these days..considering calling the onc tomorrow about anti-depressents...that was another complaint of my exbf.  He is tired of getting the sad me...I am strong all day at work so when I get home I am a bag of tears...its bringing him down too...the POOR MAN!   Sorry..went on forever this time, hopefully happy days are in the near future for ALL OF US!
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Feb 2, 2009 09:14PM Smile2006 wrote: Hello everyone!  I am going to start my first treatment next week....and this is all so scary for me.  From what I am reading I will loose my hair around day 14.  I complain about my hair daily, but I will miss it!  I just have to hope that when it grows back it will be a little thicker than it is now.
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Feb 6, 2009 11:34PM Smile2006 wrote: Thank you for the positive thoughts....I try to have those!  But it seems I stay strong all day in front of friends and co-workers but break down in the evening.  I have not told everyone...just really get tired of being asked "how are you" .  I know they mean well.....just really try not to think about it.  I know this is preventative for me....and I should be very greatful, but I dont think any of us should be going through this.  My heart breaks for everyone who has to go through this!  So Kudoos to all of YOU!  I am just beginning.....I cant wait to talk about my hair growing back and finding that flat iron....CONGRADULATION!   Hope all of you have a wonderful weekend.  It is Gasparilla here in Tampa, FL and it is suppose to be beautiful tomorrow.
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Mar 1, 2009 09:58AM Smile2006 wrote: I am on day 17 after first tx.....my hair is shedding pretty good now.  Thinking about cutting it shorter....cant bring myself to shave it off yet....
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Jun 7, 2009 08:42PM Smile2006 wrote: Hey Lisa, My eyeylashes are sparese....as well as my eyebrows...I am so happy with my permanent make up.....I am going to try the Latrisse....the new prescription for eye lashes...a friend has used it for two weeks not and WOW her lashes look great!  As for my hair...or lack of...this stinks!!!  I wish I had the courage to go topless!
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Jun 20, 2009 07:44PM Smile2006 wrote: I thought loosing my hair was the worst...but waiting for it to grow back takes the cake!!  None of my clothes fit and I refuse to go buy bigger sizes (lack of money doesnt help either)!  This is sooooo depressing!  I find myself crying all the way home from work after I take my wig off and put on my buff.....then I think of a girl I met the other day in the chemo room who had a double mastectomy, gained some wieght and is brave enough to go around without a wig, buff or cap...I was impressed, then she told me how she broke down last weekend after another girl hit on her at Walmart!   We all have issues and circumstances and absolutely do not want to be here including ME!  What are we to do but to take everyday, every minute and enjoy life!  And hope the HAIR FAIRY comes SOON!!
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Feb 8, 2009 08:58PM Smile2006 wrote: NancyD explained Gasparilla perfectly.  In my opinion, its just a reason to party.  We started out the day in the Harbour watching the Pirate ship come to shore.  Afterwards is a parade where lots and lots of beads are thrown to spectators.  We hiked it to a friends house who lives on the parade route for food, fun and dancing.  Needless to say my feet hurt and I will be going to bed early tonight.

Posts.Content: Feb 12, 2009 02:05AM Smile2006 wrote: Hi everyone!  I start today..on tx1.  I am thinking of having my hair cut shorter....to not have to worry about all the hair falling out....but to have a little fun.  I have never had really short hair, so why not now!
